info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 12 at 5:08PM EDT until July 12 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington OH
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...The following county, in central Ohio, Delaware.
* WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 508 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Columbus, Dublin, Westerville, Delaware, Powell, Sunbury, Ashley, Polaris, Shawnee Hills, Galena, Alum Creek State Park, Lewis Center, Kilbourne, Stratford, Leonardsburg, Olive Green, Center Village, Columbus Zoo and Bellepoint.
info.instruction:
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING
